findings.title: Minter role's abilities increase vulnerability to key compromise or misuse
findings.description: The `mint` and `unmint` functions can be executed by the privileged `MinterRole`, which increases the impact of accidental key disclosure, for example through a compromised web service.

findings.title: ERC2981TokenIDMask.sol: Royalties can be set to 100 percent
findings.description: The `_setDefaultRoyalties()` function does not have any checks beyond ensuring that the range is between 0 and 100 percent, allowing royalties to be misused to cover the full value of a transaction.

findings.title: Contract exposes dangerous functionality unless overridden
findings.description: The contract QuidMintablesBase.sol does not have access control and can be instantiated on its own, allowing anyone to call default mint and unmint functions.

findings.title: Contract may fail with excessively large numbers of token ID masks
findings.description: The `_tokenIDAllowed` method iterates over a dynamic array of token id masks without bounds, which may cause the contract to fail due to block gas limit if the array grows too large.

findings.title: Unnecessary function implementation already present in parent contract
findings.description: The functionality of `renounceRole` is already implemented in the parent contract, with the same access control and is not required, being redundant and more expensive to run than the parent's function.

findings.title: Reentrancy Risk in Composability Scenarios
findings.description: The mint function exposed by QuiddMintablesBase.sol and QuiddMintables.sol uses _safeTransfer when handling previously unminted tokens, making it reentrant and not protected by any mutex, which may lead to reentrancy attacks.
